info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 2:01PM MDT until June 06 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Mora County in northeastern New Mexico... Southwestern Colfax County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 245 PM MDT. * At 200 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Ocate, or 20 miles northeast of Mora, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ocate, Coyote Creek State Park, Guadalupita and El Turquillo. This includes State Road 434 between Mile Markers 10 and 18. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Heavy rains from severe thunderstorms can produce sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos, ditches and over low water crossings. Do not attempt to drive through areas where water covers the roadway.
